16#include <config.h>
17
18#include <inttypes.h>
19#include <stdbool.h>
20
21#include <isc/mem.h>
22#include <isc/once.h>
23#include <isc/string.h>
24#include <isc/util.h>
25
26#include <dns/acl.h>
27#include <dns/iptable.h>
28
29
30/*
31 * Create a new ACL, including an IP table and an array with room
32 * for 'n' ACL elements. The elements are uninitialized and the
33 * length is 0.
34 */
35isc_result_t
36dns_acl_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, int n, dns_acl_t **target) {
37 isc_result_t result;
38 dns_acl_t *acl;
39
40 /*
41 * Work around silly limitation of isc_mem_get().
42 */
43 if (n == 0)
44 n = 1;
45
46 acl = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*acl));
47 if (acl == NULL)
48 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
49
50 acl->mctx = NULL;
51 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &acl->mctx);
52
53 acl->name = NULL;
54
55 isc_refcount_init(&acl->refcount, 1);
56
57 result = dns_iptable_create(mctx, &acl->iptable);
58 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
59 isc_mem_put(mctx, acl, sizeof(*acl));
60 return (result);
61 }
62
63 acl->elements = NULL;
64 acl->alloc = 0;
65 acl->length = 0;
66 acl->has_negatives = false;
67
68 ISC_LINK_INIT(acl, nextincache);
69 /*
70 * Must set magic early because we use dns_acl_detach() to clean up.
71 */
72 acl->magic = DNS_ACL_MAGIC;
73
74 acl->elements = isc_mem_get(mctx, n * sizeof(dns_aclelement_t));
75 if (acl->elements == NULL) {
76 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
77 goto cleanup;
78 }
79 acl->alloc = n;
80 memset(acl->elements, 0, n * sizeof(dns_aclelement_t));
81 *target = acl;
82 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
83
84 cleanup:
85 dns_acl_detach(&acl);
86 return (result);
87}
88
89/*
90 * Create a new ACL and initialize it with the value "any" or "none",
91 * depending on the value of the "neg" parameter.
92 * "any" is a positive iptable entry with bit length 0.
93 * "none" is the same as "!any".
94 */
95static isc_result_t
96dns_acl_anyornone(isc_mem_t *mctx, bool neg, dns_acl_t **target) {
97 isc_result_t result;
98 dns_acl_t *acl = NULL;
99
100 result = dns_acl_create(mctx, 0, &acl);
101 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
102 return (result);
103
104 result = dns_iptable_addprefix(acl->iptable, NULL, 0, !neg);
105 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
106 dns_acl_detach(&acl);
107 return (result);
108 }
109
110 *target = acl;
111 return (result);
112}
113
114/*
115 * Create a new ACL that matches everything.
116 */
117isc_result_t
118dns_acl_any(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_acl_t **target) {
119 return (dns_acl_anyornone(mctx, false, target));
120}
121
122/*
123 * Create a new ACL that matches nothing.
124 */
125isc_result_t
126dns_acl_none(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_acl_t **target) {
127 return (dns_acl_anyornone(mctx, true, target));
128}
129
130/*
131 * If pos is true, test whether acl is set to "{ any; }"
132 * If pos is false, test whether acl is set to "{ none; }"
133 */
134static bool
135dns_acl_isanyornone(dns_acl_t *acl, bool pos)
136{
137 /* Should never happen but let's be safe */
138 if (acl == NULL ||
139 acl->iptable == NULL ||
140 acl->iptable->radix == NULL ||
141 acl->iptable->radix->head == NULL ||
142 acl->iptable->radix->head->prefix == NULL)
143 return (false);
144
145 if (acl->length != 0 || acl->node_count != 1)
146 return (false);
147
148 if (acl->iptable->radix->head->prefix->bitlen == 0 &&
149 acl->iptable->radix->head->data[0] != NULL &&
150 acl->iptable->radix->head->data[0] ==
151 acl->iptable->radix->head->data[1] &&
152 *(bool *) (acl->iptable->radix->head->data[0]) == pos)
153 return (true);
154
155 return (false); /* All others */
156}
157
158/*
159 * Test whether acl is set to "{ any; }"
160 */
161bool
162dns_acl_isany(dns_acl_t *acl)
163{
164 return (dns_acl_isanyornone(acl, true));
165}
166
167/*
168 * Test whether acl is set to "{ none; }"
169 */
170bool
171dns_acl_isnone(dns_acl_t *acl)
172{
173 return (dns_acl_isanyornone(acl, false));
174}
175
176/*
177 * Determine whether a given address or signer matches a given ACL.
178 * For a match with a positive ACL element or iptable radix entry,
179 * return with a positive value in match; for a match with a negated ACL
180 * element or radix entry, return with a negative value in match.
181 */
182
183isc_result_t
184dns_acl_match(const isc_netaddr_t *reqaddr,
185 const dns_name_t *reqsigner,
186 const dns_acl_t *acl,
187 const dns_aclenv_t *env,
188 int *match,
189 const dns_aclelement_t **matchelt)
190{
191 uint16_t bitlen;
192 isc_prefix_t pfx;
193 isc_radix_node_t *node = NULL;
194 const isc_netaddr_t *addr = reqaddr;
195 isc_netaddr_t v4addr;
196 isc_result_t result;
197 int match_num = -1;
198 unsigned int i;
199
200 REQUIRE(reqaddr != NULL);
201 REQUIRE(matchelt == NULL || *matchelt == NULL);
202
203 if (env != NULL && env->match_mapped &&
204 addr->family == AF_INET6 &&
205 IN6_IS_ADDR_V4MAPPED(&addr->type.in6))
206 {
207 isc_netaddr_fromv4mapped(&v4addr, addr);
208 addr = &v4addr;
209 }
210
211 /* Always match with host addresses. */
212 bitlen = (addr->family == AF_INET6) ? 128 : 32;
213 NETADDR_TO_PREFIX_T(addr, pfx, bitlen);
214
215 /* Assume no match. */
216 *match = 0;
217
218 /* Search radix. */
219 result = isc_radix_search(acl->iptable->radix, &node, &pfx);
220
221 /* Found a match. */
222 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && node != NULL) {
223 int fam = ISC_RADIX_FAMILY(&pfx);
224 match_num = node->node_num[fam];
225 if (*(bool *) node->data[fam]) {
226 *match = match_num;
227 } else {
228 *match = -match_num;
229 }
230 }
231
232 isc_refcount_destroy(&pfx.refcount);
233
234 /* Now search non-radix elements for a match with a lower node_num. */
235 for (i = 0; i < acl->length; i++) {
236 dns_aclelement_t *e = &acl->elements[i];
237
238 /* Already found a better match? */
239 if (match_num != -1 && match_num < e->node_num) {
240 break;
241 }
242
243 if (dns_aclelement_match(reqaddr, reqsigner, e, env, matchelt))
244 {
245 if (match_num == -1 || e->node_num < match_num) {
246 if (e->negative)
247 *match = -e->node_num;
248 else
249 *match = e->node_num;
250 }
251 break;
252 }
253 }
254
255 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
256}
257
258/*
259 * Merge the contents of one ACL into another. Call dns_iptable_merge()
260 * for the IP tables, then concatenate the element arrays.
261 *
262 * If pos is set to false, then the nested ACL is to be negated. This
263 * means reverse the sense of each *positive* element or IP table node,
264 * but leave negatives alone, so as to prevent a double-negative causing
265 * an unexpected positive match in the parent ACL.
266 */
267isc_result_t
268dns_acl_merge(dns_acl_t *dest, dns_acl_t *source, bool pos)
269{
270 isc_result_t result;
271 unsigned int newalloc, nelem, i;
272 int max_node = 0, nodes;
273
274 /* Resize the element array if needed. */
275 if (dest->length + source->length > dest->alloc) {
276 void *newmem;
277
278 newalloc = dest->alloc + source->alloc;
279 if (newalloc < 4)
280 newalloc = 4;
281
282 newmem = isc_mem_get(dest->mctx,
283 newalloc * sizeof(dns_aclelement_t));
284 if (newmem == NULL)
285 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
286
287 /* Zero. */
288 memset(newmem, 0, newalloc * sizeof(dns_aclelement_t));
289
290 /* Copy in the original elements */
291 memmove(newmem, dest->elements,
292 dest->length * sizeof(dns_aclelement_t));
293
294 /* Release the memory for the old elements array */
295 isc_mem_put(dest->mctx, dest->elements,
296 dest->alloc * sizeof(dns_aclelement_t));
297 dest->elements = newmem;
298 dest->alloc = newalloc;
299 }
300
301 /*
302 * Now copy in the new elements, increasing their node_num
303 * values so as to keep the new ACL consistent. If we're
304 * negating, then negate positive elements, but keep negative
305 * elements the same for security reasons.
306 */
307 nelem = dest->length;
308 dest->length += source->length;
309 for (i = 0; i < source->length; i++) {
310 if (source->elements[i].node_num > max_node)
311 max_node = source->elements[i].node_num;
312
313 /* Copy type. */
314 dest->elements[nelem + i].type = source->elements[i].type;
315
316 /* Adjust node numbering. */
317 dest->elements[nelem + i].node_num =
318 source->elements[i].node_num + dest->node_count;
319
320 /* Duplicate nested acl. */
321 if (source->elements[i].type == dns_aclelementtype_nestedacl &&
322 source->elements[i].nestedacl != NULL)
323 dns_acl_attach(source->elements[i].nestedacl,
324 &dest->elements[nelem + i].nestedacl);
325
326 /* Duplicate key name. */
327 if (source->elements[i].type == dns_aclelementtype_keyname) {
328 dns_name_init(&dest->elements[nelem+i].keyname, NULL);
329 result = dns_name_dup(&source->elements[i].keyname,
330 dest->mctx,
331 &dest->elements[nelem+i].keyname);
332 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
333 return result;
334 }
335
336#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
337 /* Duplicate GeoIP data */
338 if (source->elements[i].type == dns_aclelementtype_geoip) {
339 dest->elements[nelem + i].geoip_elem =
340 source->elements[i].geoip_elem;
341 }
342#endif
343
344 /* reverse sense of positives if this is a negative acl */
345 if (!pos && !source->elements[i].negative) {
346 dest->elements[nelem + i].negative = true;
347 } else {
348 dest->elements[nelem + i].negative =
349 source->elements[i].negative;
350 }
351 }
352
353 /*
354 * Merge the iptables. Make sure the destination ACL's
355 * node_count value is set correctly afterward.
356 */
357 nodes = max_node + dest->node_count;
358 result = dns_iptable_merge(dest->iptable, source->iptable, pos);
359 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
360 return (result);
361 if (nodes > dest->node_count)
362 dest->node_count = nodes;
363
364 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
365}
366
367/*
368 * Like dns_acl_match, but matches against the single ACL element 'e'
369 * rather than a complete ACL, and returns true iff it matched.
370 *
371 * To determine whether the match was positive or negative, the
372 * caller should examine e->negative. Since the element 'e' may be
373 * a reference to a named ACL or a nested ACL, a matching element
374 * returned through 'matchelt' is not necessarily 'e' itself.
375 */
376
377bool
378dns_aclelement_match(const isc_netaddr_t *reqaddr,
379 const dns_name_t *reqsigner,
380 const dns_aclelement_t *e,
381 const dns_aclenv_t *env,
382 const dns_aclelement_t **matchelt)
383{
384 dns_acl_t *inner = NULL;
385 int indirectmatch;
386 isc_result_t result;
387
388 switch (e->type) {
389 case dns_aclelementtype_keyname:
390 if (reqsigner != NULL &&
391 dns_name_equal(reqsigner, &e->keyname)) {
392 if (matchelt != NULL)
393 *matchelt = e;
394 return (true);
395 } else
396 return (false);
397
398 case dns_aclelementtype_nestedacl:
399 inner = e->nestedacl;
400 break;
401
402 case dns_aclelementtype_localhost:
403 if (env == NULL || env->localhost == NULL)
404 return (false);
405 inner = env->localhost;
406 break;
407
408 case dns_aclelementtype_localnets:
409 if (env == NULL || env->localnets == NULL)
410 return (false);
411 inner = env->localnets;
412 break;
413
414#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
415 case dns_aclelementtype_geoip:
416 if (env == NULL || env->geoip == NULL)
417 return (false);
418 return (dns_geoip_match(reqaddr, env->geoip, &e->geoip_elem));
419#endif
420 default:
421 INSIST(0);
422 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
423 }
424
425 result = dns_acl_match(reqaddr, reqsigner, inner, env,
426 &indirectmatch, matchelt);
427 INSIST(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
428
429 /*
430 * Treat negative matches in indirect ACLs as "no match".
431 * That way, a negated indirect ACL will never become a
432 * surprise positive match through double negation.
433 * XXXDCL this should be documented.
434 */
435 if (indirectmatch > 0) {
436 if (matchelt != NULL)
437 *matchelt = e;
438 return (true);
439 }
440
441 /*
442 * A negative indirect match may have set *matchelt, but we don't
443 * want it set when we return.
444 */
445 if (matchelt != NULL)
446 *matchelt = NULL;
447
448 return (false);
449}
450
451void
452dns_acl_attach(dns_acl_t *source, dns_acl_t **target) {
453 REQUIRE(DNS_ACL_VALID(source));
454
455 isc_refcount_increment(&source->refcount);
456 *target = source;
457}
458
459static void
460destroy(dns_acl_t *dacl) {
461 unsigned int i;
462
463 INSIST(!ISC_LINK_LINKED(dacl, nextincache));
464
465 for (i = 0; i < dacl->length; i++) {
466 dns_aclelement_t *de = &dacl->elements[i];
467 if (de->type == dns_aclelementtype_keyname) {
468 dns_name_free(&de->keyname, dacl->mctx);
469 } else if (de->type == dns_aclelementtype_nestedacl) {
470 dns_acl_detach(&de->nestedacl);
471 }
472 }
473 if (dacl->elements != NULL)
474 isc_mem_put(dacl->mctx, dacl->elements,
475 dacl->alloc * sizeof(dns_aclelement_t));
476 if (dacl->name != NULL)
477 isc_mem_free(dacl->mctx, dacl->name);
478 if (dacl->iptable != NULL)
479 dns_iptable_detach(&dacl->iptable);
480 isc_refcount_destroy(&dacl->refcount);
481 dacl->magic = 0;
482 isc_mem_putanddetach(&dacl->mctx, dacl, sizeof(*dacl));
483}
484
485void
486dns_acl_detach(dns_acl_t **aclp) {
487 REQUIRE(aclp != NULL && DNS_ACL_VALID(*aclp));
488 dns_acl_t *acl = *aclp;
489 *aclp = NULL;
490
491 if (isc_refcount_decrement(&acl->refcount) == 1) {
492 destroy(acl);
493 }
494}
495
496
497static isc_once_t insecure_prefix_once = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
498static isc_mutex_t insecure_prefix_lock;
499static bool insecure_prefix_found;
500
501static void
502initialize_action(void) {
503 isc_mutex_init(&insecure_prefix_lock);
504}
505
506/*
507 * Called via isc_radix_process() to find IP table nodes that are
508 * insecure.
509 */
510static void
511is_insecure(isc_prefix_t *prefix, void **data) {
512 /*
513 * If all nonexistent or negative then this node is secure.
514 */
515 if ((data[0] == NULL || !* (bool *) data[0]) &&
516 (data[1] == NULL || !* (bool *) data[1]))
517 {
518 return;
519 }
520
521 /*
522 * If a loopback address found and the other family
523 * entry doesn't exist or is negative, return.
524 */
525 if (prefix->bitlen == 32 &&
526 htonl(prefix->add.sin.s_addr) == INADDR_LOOPBACK &&
527 (data[1] == NULL || !* (bool *) data[1]))
528 {
529 return;
530 }
531
532 if (prefix->bitlen == 128 &&
533 IN6_IS_ADDR_LOOPBACK(&prefix->add.sin6) &&
534 (data[0] == NULL || !* (bool *) data[0]))
535 {
536 return;
537 }
538
539 /* Non-negated, non-loopback */
540 insecure_prefix_found = true; /* LOCKED */
541 return;
542}
543
544/*
545 * Return true iff the acl 'a' is considered insecure, that is,
546 * if it contains IP addresses other than those of the local host.
547 * This is intended for applications such as printing warning
548 * messages for suspect ACLs; it is not intended for making access
549 * control decisions. We make no guarantee that an ACL for which
550 * this function returns false is safe.
551 */
552bool
553dns_acl_isinsecure(const dns_acl_t *a) {
554 unsigned int i;
555 bool insecure;
556
557 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&insecure_prefix_once,
558 initialize_action) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
559
560 /*
561 * Walk radix tree to find out if there are any non-negated,
562 * non-loopback prefixes.
563 */
564 LOCK(&insecure_prefix_lock);
565 insecure_prefix_found = false;
566 isc_radix_process(a->iptable->radix, is_insecure);
567 insecure = insecure_prefix_found;
568 UNLOCK(&insecure_prefix_lock);
569 if (insecure)
570 return (true);
571
572 /* Now check non-radix elements */
573 for (i = 0; i < a->length; i++) {
574 dns_aclelement_t *e = &a->elements[i];
575
576 /* A negated match can never be insecure. */
577 if (e->negative)
578 continue;
579
580 switch (e->type) {
581 case dns_aclelementtype_keyname:
582 case dns_aclelementtype_localhost:
583 continue;
584
585 case dns_aclelementtype_nestedacl:
586 if (dns_acl_isinsecure(e->nestedacl))
587 return (true);
588 continue;
589
590#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
591 case dns_aclelementtype_geoip:
592#endif
593 case dns_aclelementtype_localnets:
594 return (true);
595
596 default:
597 INSIST(0);
598 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
599 }
600 }
601
602 /* No insecure elements were found. */
603 return (false);
604}
605
606
607/*%
608 * Check whether an address/signer is allowed by a given acl/aclenv.
609 */
610bool
611dns_acl_allowed(isc_netaddr_t *addr, dns_name_t *signer,
612 dns_acl_t *acl, dns_aclenv_t *aclenv)
613{
614 int match;
615 isc_result_t result;
616
617 if (acl == NULL) {
618 return (true);
619 }
620 result = dns_acl_match(addr, signer, acl, aclenv, &match, NULL);
621 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && match > 0) {
622 return (true);
623 }
624 return (false);
625}
626
627/*
628 * Initialize ACL environment, setting up localhost and localnets ACLs
629 */
630isc_result_t
631dns_aclenv_init(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_aclenv_t *env) {
632 isc_result_t result;
633
634 env->localhost = NULL;
635 env->localnets = NULL;
636 result = dns_acl_create(mctx, 0, &env->localhost);
637 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
638 goto cleanup_nothing;
639 result = dns_acl_create(mctx, 0, &env->localnets);
640 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
641 goto cleanup_localhost;
642 env->match_mapped = false;
643#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
644 env->geoip = NULL;
645#endif
646 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
647
648 cleanup_localhost:
649 dns_acl_detach(&env->localhost);
650 cleanup_nothing:
651 return (result);
652}
653
654void
655dns_aclenv_copy(dns_aclenv_t *t, dns_aclenv_t *s) {
656 dns_acl_detach(&t->localhost);
657 dns_acl_attach(s->localhost, &t->localhost);
658 dns_acl_detach(&t->localnets);
659 dns_acl_attach(s->localnets, &t->localnets);
660 t->match_mapped = s->match_mapped;
661#ifdef HAVE_GEOIP
662 t->geoip = s->geoip;
663#endif
664}
665
666void
667dns_aclenv_destroy(dns_aclenv_t *env) {
668 if (env->localhost != NULL)
669 dns_acl_detach(&env->localhost);
670 if (env->localnets != NULL)
671 dns_acl_detach(&env->localnets);
672}
